title: Ben & Jerry's joins monthlong Facebook ad boycott

title: Facebook kills off its cheapest VR headset
text: Just two years after launch, Facebook announced today that it’s discontinuing the Oculus Go, the least powerful and least expensive virtual reality headset that the company sold.

title: Facebook says goodbye to Oculus Go, opens up Oculus Quest to new apps
text: The Go's last days are here, but the Quest is opening up in 2021.

title: Antitrust case against Facebook’s ‘super profiling’ back on track after German federal court ruling
text: A landmark regulatory intervention that seeks to apply structural antitrust remedies to cut big (ad)tech’s rights-hostile surveillance business models down to size has been revived after Germany’s federal court overturned an earlier ruling that had suspended enforcement of a ban on Facebook combining user data.

title: Facebook Continues Its Gaming Push With Another Studio Acquisition
text: Video-game software has been the driving force for the company's Oculus virtual-reality platform.

title: The List of Companies Boycotting Facebook Advertising Grows
text: A handful of brands have signed on to pressure the social networking platform into changing its policies.

title: Top German court reimposes data curbs on Facebook
text: Facebook must comply with an order by Germany's antitrust watchdog to curb data collection from users, a top German court ruled on Tuesday, in a setback for the U.S. social network company.

title: Instagram expands Shopping to more businesses, including creators selling their merch
text: Instagram announced today it’s expanding access to Instagram Shopping to more businesses, including creators who want to sell their own merchandise. To enable this expansion, the company introduced new “Commerce Eligibility Requirements” that offer a set of guidelines that interested businesses must adhere to, in order to qualify for Instagram selling.

title: Ben & Jerry’s CEO says Facebook ad boycott doesn’t go far enough
text: The boss of Ben & Jerry’s says the ice cream slinger is considering joining a growing Facebook ads boycott, but thinks it doesn’t go far enough. title: Key Words: Tech-backed group blasts Trump’s order on work visas as ‘full-frontal attack on American innovation and our nation’s ability to benefit from attracting talent’
text: Business groups are reacting to the Trump administration’s order targeting work visas.

title: Facebook tests Forecast, an app for making predictions about world events, like COVID-19
text: Forecast, a new project from Facebook’s internal R&D group, NPE Team, is launching today to build a community around predictions. The iOS app will allow users to ask questions and then use in-app points to make predictions about what might happen in the future.

title: Tech Giants Face Advertisement Challenges Amid Coronavirus
